text: Iodine pentoxide, also known as iodine(V) oxide and diiodine pentoxide is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is I2O5. It has iodine and oxide ions. The iodine is in its +5 oxidation state. ==Properties== Iodine pentoxide is a white solid. It breaks down to iodine and oxygen when heated. It reacts with carbon monoxide to make carbon dioxide and iodine. It is a strong oxidizing agent. It reacts with water to make iodic acid. ==Preparation== Iodine pentoxide is made by heating iodic acid to in dry air. ==Uses== It is used to see how much carbon monoxide is in a sample of gas. ==Related pages== *Iodine pentafluoride *Iodine trifluoride *Iodine monochloride Category:Iodine compounds Category:Oxides
title: Iodine pentoxide
